comments:
Steps:

Import an Apache HTTP Server access log with 1.3.x(rules) version from a Linux 
IA32 machine.
Set the filter (ex: show 2 events)

"java.lang.NullPointerException" occurs.

This happens while importing any log file with filters. I have tried few times 
and had the same error and log report.
Works fine without filters.
Also works fine when I import from local machine (WindowsXP) with filters.

Created an attachment (id=28550)
NullPointerException when importing a log file with filter from remote Linux
IA32

Alex, can you please look into this problem today.  It looks like it is in your 
code.

It looks like the file transfer is failing to initialize and the call
FileManagerFactory.getInstance().create(node.getConnection());	
always returns a null value on the Linux box that I used for testing. 
As a consequence the log import with filter fails.
I have added code to handle the null pointer exception in the GLAFilterHelper 
code and now a reasonable error message is displayed.

Scott I'll assign this defect to you for further investigations, currently the 
log import with filter is broken because of this problem.

I am attaching a screen capture of my workbench debug view, as you can see 
there a lot of instances of ReusableThread running which are not cleaned up 
after calling 
fileManager = FileManagerFactory.getInstance().create(node.getConnection());

Tested on another Linux IA32, with TPTPDC-4.1.0_200510200100 and the latest 
client code 20051021, the same failure.

I fixed a problem that prevented the file system services server from coming up
in Linux but I still cannot import a log file; it looks like it is trying to
download a file from the Linux machine but it uses Windows temp path to prefix it.

Please update to the latest CVS code as of this typing and see if there are
additional problems in the GLA part of the code for Linux.  Thanks.  The tons of
reusable threads were done to the file server not being detected, so it kept
trying and trying, using old file transfer protocols etc.  In the future my code
should abort if not connected within a certain specified time such as 2 minutes
or so.

Created an attachment (id=28621)
IOException due to invalid path in Linux

BMP attached.

I attached a screenshot (.bmp) of the issue I saw -- could be a user-error but I
somehow got it in this state.

Build: TPTP-4.1.0-200510250100  and TPTP-4.1.0-200510240100 

Import a log file using filter from Linux IA32 mahcine.

Now I can see that the log file is imported correctly with the filter applied.

But the following Exception appears in the console of the Linux machine 
whenever I do an import with filter.
